Title: Missing git tags and releases
Body: The latest git tag/release is 3.0.5. Currently there's no changelog and not having the tags makes it even harder to see what's changed between releases.<\n>

Title: Help me please.
Body:
I want to make a bot in Discord<c> the code and the bot itself are ready<c> only one problem. I write "npm install discord.js —save" and spouts it out: <><
>npm ERR! Linux 4.4.23+<><
>npm ERR! argv "/data/data/io.tempage.dorynode/files/bin/node" "/data/user/0/io.tempage.dorynode/files/npm/bin/npm-cli.js" "install" "discord.js" "—save"<><
>npm ERR! node v6.11.4<><
>npm ERR! npm v3.10.10<><
>npm ERR! file /storage/emulated/0/Download/package.json<><
>npm ERR! code EJSONPARSE<><
><><
>npm ERR! Failed to parse json<><
>npm ERR! Unexpected token 'c' at 1:1<><
>npm ERR! const Discord = require('discord.js');<><
>npm ERR! ^<><
>npm ERR! File: /storage/emulated/0/Download/package.json<><
>npm ERR! Failed to parse package.json data.<><
>npm ERR! package.json must be actual JSON<c> not just JavaScript.<><
>npm ERR! <><
>npm ERR! This is not a bug in npm.<><
>npm ERR! Tell the package author to fix their package.json file. JSON.parse<><
><><

>npm ERR! /storage/emulated/0/Download/npm-debug.log<><
>code : 1 / signal : 0<><
>What is this?<><
>How this fix?<
>

Title: Update map-stream to latest version that has MIT license
Body: The version 0.1.0 of map-stream doesn't have a license specified. Update to the latest version 0.0.7 that has MIT license.<\n>

Title: toString() failed
Body:
Hello<c><><
><><
>I am trying to use this library to read from a buffer line by line<c> below the code I use : <><
><><
>```js<><
>const es = require('event-stream');<><
>const stream = require('stream');<><
><><
>let bufferStream = new stream.PassThrough();<><
>bufferStream.end(myBuffer);<><
><><
>bufferStream<><
>	.pipe(es.split())<><
>	.pipe(es.mapSync(function(line){<><
><><
>			// pause the readstream<><
>			bufferStream.pause();<><
><><
>			// DO SOME PROCESSING OF THIS LINE<><
><><
>			// resume the readstream<c> possibly from a callback<><
>			bufferStream.resume();<><
><><
>		}).on('error'<c> function(err){<><
>			console.log('Error while reading file.' + err);<><
>		}).on('end'<c> function(){<><
>			console.log('end event !');<><
>		}).on('close'<c> function(){<><
>			console.log('close event !');<><
>		})<><
>	);<><
>```<><
><><
>It seems awsome<c> but the problem is that I get an error - feels like a noob error :( <><
>```<><
>buffer.js:556<><
> if (encoding === 'utf8') return buf.utf8Slice(start<c> end);<><
> ^<><
><><
>Error: "toString()" failed<><
> at stringSlice (buffer.js:556:43)<><
> at Buffer.toString (buffer.js:629:10)<><
> at StringDecoder.utf8Text [as text] (string_decoder.js:201:16)<><
> at StringDecoder.write (string_decoder.js:85:46)<><
> at Stream.<anonymous> (...
ode_modules\split\index.js:53:24)<><
> at Stream.stream.write (...
ode_modules	hrough\index.js:26:11)<><
> at PassThrough.ondata (_stream_readable.js:628:20)<><
> at emitOne (events.js:115:13)<><
> at PassThrough.emit (events.js:210:7)<><
> at PassThrough.Readable.read (_stream_readable.js:464:10)<><
> at flow (_stream_readable.js:835:34)<><
> at resume_ (_stream_readable.js:817:3)<><
> at _combinedTickCallback (internal/process/next_tick.js:138:11)<><
> at process._tickCallback (internal/process/next_tick.js:180:9)<><
><><
>```<><
><><
>Do you know what's happening ?<><
><><
>Thank for the lib anyway !<><
><><
>Regards.<
>

Title: tarball url in package.json could be with https
Body:
Hello devs<c><><
><><
>Thank you for your great work.<><
>In packages.json the tarball url is with http. According to [this](https://blog.npmjs.org/post/142077474335/npm-registry-is-now-fully-https)<c> registry.npmjs.org redirect all http requests to https anyway.<><
>We would not append our proxy rules just for this.<
>

Title: How to keep the original stream data unchanged?
Body:
I am using event-stream to process a http request payload. The payload is a I to the interested fields. The code is something like below<c> <><
>```<><
>import JSONStream from 'JSONStream';<><
>import eventStream from 'event-stream';<><
><><
>async function processPayload(request) {<><
> const payload = request.payload;<><
> let = payload<c> eventStream.mapSync(function(data){<><
> indexArray.push(data);<><
> })<><
> );<><
> return indexArray;<><
>}<><
>```<><
><><
>Basically the above code the is the original payload<c> so the following the payload as well fails. How can I keep the original data being unchanged? Thanks!<><
><
>

Title: Dependency to map-stream
Body:
Hi<c> `package.json` specifies dependency to `"map-stream": "~0.1.0"` which I am unable to find in repo https://github.com/dominictarr/map-stream.<
><
>My issue is that installed `map-stream 0.1.0` has custom licence and `map-stream 0.0.6` has MIT (preferable). Can you please take a look and update package dependency?<
><
>Reproduce<
><
>```<
>npm init -y<
>npm i --save map-stream@0.1.0<
>cat node_modules/map-stream/LICENCE<
>cat node_modules/map-stream/package.json<
>```<
><
>

Title: emits "end" if no streams
Body: If there streams I a of because I was merging a variable size array of streams that happen to be empty.<\n><\n>

Title: Handle mapSync() exceptions as stream errors
Body:
This patch allows synchronious callback to properly<
>report errors to the stream by throwing exceptions.<
><
>mapSync() will convert them into the stream errors<c><
>catchable with on('error' ...)<
><
>https://github.com/dominictarr/event-stream/issues/94<
><
>P.S. The trailing spaces got automatically cleaned up by IDE<
><
>

Title: exception in mapSync causes fatal error
Body:
The error thrown in the middle of the mapSync() cases application exception. Shouldn't mapSync handle that? Also<c> do I need to do `on('error')` after each stream transformation?<
><
>``` lang=js<
>return new Promise(function (resolve<c> reject) {<
> var s = fs.createReadStream(srcFile)<
> .on('error'<c> reject)<
> .pipe(es.split())<
> .on('error'<c> reject)<
> .pipe(es.mapSync(function (line) {<
> ...<
> throw new Error();<
> ...<
> }).on('error'<c> reject)<
> .pipe(fs.createWriteStream(outputFile))<
> .on('error'<c> reject)<
> .on('finish'<c> function () {<
> resolve(outputFile);<
> });<
>});<
>```<
><
>

Title: es.merge broke my data
Body:
I have 12 files to handle<c> so I want to create 12 ReadStreams and merge to one.<
><
>In each file<c> each line is a JSON string.<
><
>My code is like this: <
><
>```<
> fileNames = fileNames.filter(Boolean);<
> es.merge(fileNames.map(function(item<c> index) {<
> return fs.createReadStream(item);<
> }))<
> .pipe(es.split())<
> .pipe(es.parse())<
>```<
><
>After run it<c> I got some JSON.parse error like this: <
><
>> SyntaxError: Unexpected token <
><
>and I found the error json looks like this:<
><
>```<
>{"ts":1452700832306<c>"segments":{"sex":1<c>"age":5<c>"os":1<c>"deviceprice":5}<c>"appkey":"560129b88bda20a5270f88da"<c>"token":"jXL29pROAnEGng"<c>"deviceid":"D4FB58CD-39{"ts":1452700810077<c>"appkey":"560129b88bda20a5270f88da"<c>"token":"jXL29pROAnEGng"<c>"deviceid":"B8DA0F64C613E896B412788B9BDB06D4"}<
>```<
><
>I grep **1452700832306** and **1452700810077**<c> and find they come from two different files:<
><
>in file1<c> test1.log: <
><
>```<
>{"ts":1452700832306<c>"segments":{"sex":1<c>"age":5<c>"os":1<c>"deviceprice":5}<c>"appkey":"560129b88bda20a5270f88da"<c>"token":"jXL29pROAnEGng"<c>"deviceid":"D4FB58CD-39CF-4445-AD26-C85194C0D032"}<
>```<
><
>in file2<c> test2.log:<
><
>```<
>{"ts":1452700810077<c>"appkey":"560129b88bda20a5270f88da"<c>"token":"jXL29pROAnEGng"<c>"deviceid":"B8DA0F64C613E896B412788B9BDB06D4"}<
>```<
><
>So it looks like some of my data has been broken.<
><
>**Node version**: v4.2.3<
>**OS**: CentOS Linux release 7.0.1406 (Core)<
><
>

><

> process.stdout<c><
> process.stderr<
>).pipe(fs.createWriteStream('output.log'));<

Title: es.split generate a empty line for trailing newline
Body: es.split is mostly used for processing line by line<c> however we usually get an empty line at the end of the file. Please remove trailing newline.<\n><\n>

Title: Add a es.chain?
Body:
I like this js<
>function chain(...streams) {<
> var [head] = var = streams.reduce((prev<c> curr) => return that I can write<
><
>``` js<
>function formatter() {<
> return chain(<
> es.split()<c><
> es.mapSync(...)<c><
> es.stringify()<
> );<
>}<
><
>someStream.pipe(formatter());<
>```<
><
>Would you like this added to event-stream? If yes please also tell me what behaviour you want<c> e.g. multiple arguments what to also I can go PR.<
><
>

Title: Fix spelling error in index.js
Body: Fixed spelling error in console.error from "attemping to parse" to "attempting to parse"<\n><\n>

Title: minor tweak to a few headings in readme
Body: Adjusts a few headings so they're more noticeable at https://www.npmjs.com/package/event-stream<\n><\n>

Title: Allow Array input for es.concat
Body:
Currently `es.concat` does not work if an Array is passed to it. The `arguments` object will look like this: `{"0": streamArray<c> length: 1}`<
><
>That makes the function hard to work with plugins like [gulp-src-files](https://github.com/59naga/gulp-src-files).<
><
>I added a check to see if `toMerge` is an array itself or is an object contains an array<c> also updated asynct file.<
><
>

Title: broken test: when replacing whitespace
Body: Caused by a bug in 'split'<c> PR for fix in split: https://github.com/dominictarr/split/pull/14<\n><\n>

Title: Updated documentation to indicate es.wait may return a buffer
Body: `es.wait` was changed to support Buffer concatenation<c> and may not always pass a string to its second callback argument. This updates the documentation to indicate the type may be a String or Buffer.<\n><\n>

Title: Add option to .parse() to emit error events for parsing errors.
Body: Test cases are written for only invalid inputs; should be trivial to write tests for valid inputs<c> but such cases were untested before<c> tests for them deserve another commit<c> I suppose.<\n><\n>

Title: Fixes bug where non-JSON breaks everything.
Body: In certain plugins for Strider not all events are in JSON and this causes blocking errors. This alleviates that problem.<\n><\n>

Title: Add text on readArray v0.10 streams
Body: In response to issue #60<\n><\n>

Title: Clarify licensing
Body: This is an attempt to make the license of this library detectable by the license-checker tool.<\n><\n>

Title: Fix some spelling mistakes in README
add buffer support for es.wait
Body: Chunks should be buffer when using es.wait for concat chunks<c> as in [gulp-untar](https://github.com/jmerrifield/gulp-untar/blob/master/index.js#L37). And it will result [encode issue](https://github.com/spmjs/spmjs.io/issues/30) if just use `+` to concat.<\n><\n>

Title: Recursive next tick fix
Body:
Recursive process.nextTick causes this on nodejs 0.10:<
><
>```<
>(node) warning: Recursive process.nextTick detected. This will break in the next version of node. Please use setImmediate for recursive deferral.<
>(node) warning: Recursive process.nextTick detected. This will break in the next version of node. Please use setImmediate for recursive deferral.<
>(node) warning: Recursive process.nextTick detected. This will break in the next version of node. Please use setImmediate for recursive deferral.<
>(node) warning: Recursive process.nextTick detected. This will break in the next version of node. Please use setImmediate for recursive deferral.<
>(node) warning: Recursive process.nextTick detected. This will break in the next version of node. Please use setImmediate for recursive deferral.<
>(node) warning: Recursive process.nextTick detected. This will break in the next version of node. Please use setImmediate for recursive deferral.<
>(node) warning: Recursive process.nextTick detected. This will break in the next version of node. Please use setImmediate for recursive ERR! for ERR! not ok code 0<
><
>```<
><
>This patch fixes it.<
><
>

Title: Fix bug in merge() function
Body:
If output stream is destroyed input streams are now properly destroyed<c> too.<
>There was a typo. :-)<
><
>

Title: Allow adding more than 11 streams to es.merge
Body:
This is a better fix for the PR at https://github.com/dominictarr/event-stream/pull/53.<
>It sets the listener limit to unlimited<c> but only for the merge stream and not globally. <
>Also it will work on more Node versions. :beer: <
><
>

Title: Allow more than 10 streams in es.concat
Body: Without triggering the 'possible EventEmitter memory leak detected' warning.<\n><\n>

Title: Added stream-series
Body:
I found myself needing a way to merge and maintain order<c> so I wrote [stream-series](http://github.com/rschmukler/stream-series). I think it fits well in your collection of stream manipulation utils.<
><
>Thanks for writing all of these great stream functions!<
><
>Cheers<
><
>

Title: Include merge/concat method in readme
Body: As part of https://github.com/dominictarr/event-stream/issues/47<\n><\n>
